title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: We accomplished, with some difficulty, a visit to Loch Katrine and Loch Lomond, and, by dint of the hospitality of Cambus- more and the Ross, we defied bad weather, wet roads, and long walks.

title: A university tramp,
author: Hubbell, Orrin Z. [from old catalog]
snippet: This rock was used as a place of defense as early as 80, A. D.; the castle is of ancient origin though most of it was erected by James III, whose tomb is at Cambus- kenneth Abbey, about a half mile away.
